Text.Value: *But it'll all be for nothing if you don't find help soon.*
*What delicacies might abound? Only one way to find out...*
*The chaos of the crash site confuses the landscape. You'll need to find a settlement or landmark.*
Recall everything you know about illithid tadpoles.
Ponder your miraculous survival.
*You half-expected your memories to return once you were free of the mind flayer ship, but your past is still an aching void.*
*And, of course, you'll be feeding for two now, thanks to your guest. Until it deigns to feast on your brains and split you open to reveal a newborn mind flayer...*
Forget the parasite and savour the warmth of the sun. You are reborn.
I did it. I got out.

EditorData.NodeContext: A moment of awe/ emotion, realizing she did in fact escape Avernus at last.

Text.Value: Forget the hunter. I'm more afraid of the parasite in my head.
Don't be daft. That parasite will turn me into a mind flayer if I don't find a cure.
*Despite your recent fall from the nautiloid, you are miraculously unharmed. Apart from the volatile orb of netherese magic buried within your chest, of course.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Small glance down towards chest/heart, concerned expression

Text.Value: *But only if you can find a cure first. The tadpole must be evicted - be it by blade, magic, or any other means you can find.*
*You feel nothing. But of course, Lady Shar is no crass teacher, bludgeoning you with her instructions.*
Forget the hunter and the parasite. I'm more concerned about the infernal engine burning out.
*According to what you've read, you have but seven days to find a cure... or that's the end of you. Better get moving.*

EditorData.stateContext: Player is standing. A little dazed after waking on the beach.

Text.Value: Better ten bugs than another day in the Hells. Than another hour.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined, glad to be free, unwilling to go back.

Text.Value: Yes. YES! Should be able to follow the river straight to Baldur's Gate. Easy.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wonder and happiness that she's home at last.

Text.Value: *But not as alien as the creature hiding deep inside your head. You must get rid of it.*
Removing the tadpole is all that matters now. Unless you find a cure, your hunting days are over.
If it looks like the Sword Coast, smells like the Sword Coast, and feels like the fucking Sword Coast...

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach trying to suss if she's on the Sword Coast and realizing she is

Text.Value: *It's safe with you - Lady Shar's mission can still be fulfilled.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Mimes checking something on her hip, out of frame. Expression relaxes.

Text.Value: Orient yourself - where did you land?
I'll sort it. I always do. Might even have a little fun bashing devil bootlickers along the way.
*Other than the infection, you're more or less intact. A miracle, given everything you've been through.*
Perhaps you are being too harsh. The tadpole gifted you the sun, after all...
INFECTED BY A MIND FLAYER PARASITE!
*As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player gets to their feet groggily.

Text.Value: *The opposite, in fact. Your skin tingles pleasantly. Like the caress of a lover who doesn't know any better yet.*
Been through a lot, but I draw the line at becoming a mind flayer. I'll sort it. I always do.
*The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
*Perhaps it would be wise to focus on finding a cure. As wonderful as the sun is, you can hardly enjoy it if your face rips open.*
*Perhaps. But you need to help her before she can return the favour. High time you got back to the hunt.*
Maybe your patron can help with the tadpole.
ALIVE!
*And you'll need to do it quickly.*
You'll find a way to fix this. You are Gale of Waterdeep, after all.
*Sunlight. Your first instinct is to flinch from it and hide in the safety of shadows. But to your astonishment, there is no pain.*
OUT OF THE HELLS!
Yeah, yeah, one crisis at a time, hm?
No doubt Zariel will be on my trail soon. Think I even spotted one of her hunters on the ship. I better get moving.
The artefact. You need to make sure it's secure.
*Your head whispers vengeance: you cannot wait to slice your way forth, seeking whatever wrought this tragedy upon you.*
*That great mind is little more than a playground for a parasite right now. The tadpole must be disposed of.*
*Your mind doesn't want to cooperate. Every time you try to focus on the hunt before you, thoughts of the tadpole brush it aside. You have to find a cure.*
*You know a good deal about illithids and the process known as ceremorphosis. None of it good.*
*If you don't find a way to remove the tadpole burrowed in your brain soon, your future will be as blank as your past.*
Check yourself for injuries.
*Tentacles. Horror. Blood. Oblivion. Only some of those sound appealing.*
*It hurts just to think, but you need to get your bearings. You went to Avernus as a hunter, but you've left it as prey. Not to devils, but to the tadpole in your brain.*
*Your stomach rudely announces itself to you with a twinge. Unfortunately, you cannot eat sunlight. Time you found some prey.*
*But beneath the skin, flesh, and bone, there is a much more unpleasant sensation. Something nibbles and burrows where it does not belong. The tadpole, nestled in your brain.*
*It stirs softly. Soon it will hunger, and when that time comes it must be fed. Starve it, and you risk triggering a cataclysmic explosion of raw, unfettered Weave.*
*It was indeed miraculous... and perhaps a little suspicious. But it will have been for nothing if you don't find a way to remove the tadpole. And quickly.*
*Your patron might see things differently. But if the tadpole has its way, in a few days you won't be worrying about her or anything else.*
*Your head spins as you gather yourself. Fresh air and firm ground feel almost alien to you.*
Ye gods! Can it be... I'm... I'm...
Focus. You have a devil called Karlach to hunt.
Just the thought of nibbling reminds you - it's high time you found some prey to sup on.
HOME!
*She wants you to solve this on your own - prove yourself to her. First the parasite, then the mission. You are on the right track already.*
Now - time to march. I've got a life to live. Finally.

EditorData.NodeContext: Last node in her first dialogue. She's relieved and happy but determined to make progress.

Text.Value: *But it will also bring transformation, given time. Into a mind flayer.*
For good. Forever. No matter what.
Offer the Dark Lady silent thanks for your survival this far. Beg her for guidance.
Forget the hunter, the parasite, and the engine. I'M HOME, GODS DAMN IT! HOME!
*Such an explosion will be unavoidable, if the tadpole in your skull triggers ceremorphosis. An outcome definitely best avoided.*
Step one: get far away from anything with tentacles. Step two: stay calm and don't burn anything down. Step three: find allies who won't mind a friend who spends a lot of time talking to herself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Last node in her first dialogue. She's relieved and happy but determined to make progress.

Text.Value: And not a devil to be found. This is it. I'm finally free.

EditorData.NodeContext: A moment of awe/ emotion, realizing she did in fact escape Avernus at last.

Synopsis:
This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.
It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.
